modules.description: Adds ANSI escape codes to format text in specific colors, including red and cyan, and provides a reset signal for terminal output. Operates on strings and uses a predefined list of color-code pairs. Used to dynamically apply color formatting in terminal-based applications.

Returns the current ocamlformat version, generates a preset configuration, and writes it to a specified file. Operates on strings and file paths. Used to retrieve version details and save default formatting settings for later use.

Provides functions to generate and serialize a default configuration for ocamlformat, including formatting rules and style preferences. Works with OCaml's abstract syntax tree and configuration records. Used to initialize consistent code formatting across projects or to inspect default settings during development.

Injects ANSI color codes into strings for styled terminal output, with support for red, cyan, and reset sequences. Provides version retrieval and configuration file generation for ocamlformat, enabling dynamic formatting and setup management. Functions operate on strings and file paths, allowing colorized logs and automated configuration saves. Can display colored error messages or generate default .ocamlformat files for project setup.
